alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 8:49AM CDT until April 16 at 1:50PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arkansas and west central Arkansas, including the following counties, in northwest Arkansas, Crawford. In west central Arkansas, Franklin and Sebastian. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Van Buren... Ozark... Charleston... Cedarville... Mountainburg... Natural Dam... Greenwood... Alma... Barling... Lavaca... Mulberry... Dyer... Hackett... Altus... Huntington... Bonanza... Branch... Midland... Denning... - This includes the following highways... Interstate 540 between mile markers 1 and 14. Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 0 and 42. Interstate 49 between mile markers 22 and 40. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
